However, if you experience pain or other symptoms, it might be necessary to have further evaluation to understand the cause and decide on the best course of action.

Costochondritis is a condition where the cartilage that connects your ribs to your breastbone becomes inflamed. This can cause chest pain, which might feel sharp or aching. It's important to know that while the pain can be uncomfortable, costochondritis is not dangerous and usually goes away on its own. The pain might get worse with certain movements or when you press on the area. Rest, over-the-counter pain relievers, and applying heat or ice can help ease the discomfort. If the pain persists or worsens, it's a good idea to talk to a healthcare provider.
